name: SOUTH ALLEGHENY SCHOOL DISTRICT, Appellant, v. SOUTH ALLEGHENY EDUCATION ASSOCIATION
name_abbreviation: South Allegheny School District v. South Allegheny Education Ass'n

judges: Before EAGEN, C. J., and O’BRIEN, ROBERTS, POMEROY, NIX and MANDERINO, JJ.
parties: SOUTH ALLEGHENY SCHOOL DISTRICT, Appellant, v. SOUTH ALLEGHENY EDUCATION ASSOCIATION.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
We have treated the appeal as a petition for allowance of appeal and said petition is granted.
The order of the Commonwealth Court, 360 A.2d 829, is affirmed.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: John A. Caputo, Pittsburgh, for appellant.
Ronald N. Watzman, Pittsburgh, for South Allegheny. Daniel R. Delaney, Pittsburgh, for South Allegheny Education Association.
casebody.head_matter:
368 A.2d 270
SOUTH ALLEGHENY SCHOOL DISTRICT, Appellant, v. SOUTH ALLEGHENY EDUCATION ASSOCIATION.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
Argued March 10, 1977.
Decided April 28, 1977.
John A. Caputo, Pittsburgh, for appellant.
Ronald N. Watzman, Pittsburgh, for South Allegheny. Daniel R. Delaney, Pittsburgh, for South Allegheny Education Association.
Before EAGEN, C. J., and O’BRIEN, ROBERTS, POMEROY, NIX and MANDERINO, JJ.
